metadata.title: CVE-2019-10164 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
PostgreSQL versions 10.x before 10.9 and versions 11.x before 11.4 arevulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. Any authenticated user canoverflow a stack-based buffer by changing the user's own password to apurpose-crafted value. This often suffices to execute arbitrary code as thePostgreSQL operating system account.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10164` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.9-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libecpg6 - 10.9-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 10.9-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpq5 - 10.9-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-10 - 10.9-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.9-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.9-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.9-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.9-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.9-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.9-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
